candidates.title: :wrench: add missing features
candidates.body: When publishing, several drivers failed to build because the were inheriting features from the workspace. This commit adds features to the drivers' `Cargo.toml` files so they can build on their own.

candidates.title: Drop backend crates
candidates.body: When I started this project, I was new to Rust. I don't know why I thought the back-ends needed to be crates; no one is ever going to use them as a dependency. This pull-request moves the contents into the `drmemd` source tree and removes the crates.

candidates.title: Resolve #88
candidates.body: This pull request will close issue #88.

candidates.title: Improve some code
candidates.body:
Added several improvements:

- In the logic block evaluator, the solar and time variables now restrict the second level field instead of using `&str`.
- Updated the dependencies.
- Remove compiler warnings from test code.

candidates.title: prep for v0.4.0
candidates.body:
Miscellaneous commits to prep for v0.4.0:

- Bump version number on all crates
- Pull in latest crates
  - Fix any API changes
  - Run all tests

*NOTE: This is not the v0.4.0 release! This is to make sure things compile. There are still a few features to be added to the release.*

candidates.title: Pr issue107
candidates.body: Adds an alpha channel to the `Color` type.

candidates.title: Pull request with miscellaneous changes
candidates.body:
This pull request contains a few miscellaneous changes:

- Some clean-up in the logic block grammar.
- Optimized time-of-day wake-ups for logic blocks.

candidates.title: Solar position pull-request
candidates.body: This pull-request contains code that calculates the sun's position.

candidates.title: Miscellaneous additions
candidates.body: These are several, minor, unrelated changes.

candidates.title: Color type
candidates.body: This pull request adds `Color` to the `device::Value` enumeration. Devices can now use color!

candidates.title: Pull request
candidates.body: Miscellaneous updates that have so associated issues.

candidates.title: Miscellaneous commits
candidates.body: This pull request contains several, small, unrelated commits that I didn't want to create individual issues for. The biggest change was refactoring the `Error` type; see its commit message and diffs for more information.

candidates.title: Pull request for #91
candidates.body: This pull request contains effort to complete issue #91.

candidates.title: Fix regression in TP-Link driver
candidates.body: Fixes a bug introduced in 5f033095491b38d20427e04f283b8ad1cd280f29. I was trying to create a dynamically-sized buffer without resorting to `unsafe` code. But it didn't work. This pull request includes a test that will detect if the code breaks (if I try to improve it in the future.)

candidates.title: Add time-of-day driver
candidates.body: This pull request adds a time-of-day driver to DrMem. This is an internal driver for `drmemd` so it's always available.

candidates.title: :bug: add `sync` feature to `Cargo.toml`
candidates.body: This crate would probably not build on its own without this feature.

candidates.title: :bug: fix dependencies
candidates.body: The TP-Link driver would compile fine when building `drmemd`. However, when trying to publish it to crates.io, it would fail. This commit enables the features that the driver requires.

candidates.title: :bug: handle broken TCP connections
candidates.body: This commit propagates netwok errors to the main loop and will cause the driver to create a new socket. This will handle all errors; getting out of sync, broken socket connections, etc.

candidates.title: Pull request
candidates.body: Make `drmem_api::types::Error` Clonable.

candidates.title: Pull request
candidates.body: Use clippy recommendations and update dependencies.

candidates.title: Miscellaneous updates
candidates.body:
- Improve network performance for `tplink` driver. Bump to v0.1.1.
- Reduce features in dependent crates.

candidates.title: Miscellaneous changes
candidates.body: While working on an issue, several minor, unrelated changes were made. Rather than pollute the other pull request, I thought I'd roll them into this misc. pull request.

candidates.title: :bug: driver wasn't detecting a stale TCP connection
candidates.body:
This driver was using `tokio::net::TcpStream` to connect to the RPi that was monitoring the sump pump. If that connection broke (due to a power outage, for instance), the driver would wait forever and would never get any data from the remote end.

This commit pulls in the `socket2` crate so that we can turn on the "keep-alive" option for the socket (`tokio` doesn't provide this option.)

Note that we use the `socket2` crate's API to build, configure, and connect the socket before converting it to a `tokio` socket. The `socket2` API is synchronous so, for connecting, I set the timeout to 0.1 seconds. This is more than enough time to connect and it minimizes the amount of time taken away from other async tasks.

candidates.title: TP-Link driver
candidates.body: This pull request intends to complete #66.

candidates.title: :arrow_up: update `toml` crate to 0.7
candidates.body: This required some changes since the TOML library no longer likes to keep references to the text.

candidates.title: More work for issues #6 and #13
candidates.body: This is an ongoing pull-request to finish work mentioned in #13, which will allow progress on issue #6.

candidates.title: :bookmark: set versions to 0.2.0
candidates.body: Releasing v0.2.0. Make sure the crates have this version.

candidates.title: Add new fields to query
candidates.body: This pull request will close #30.

candidates.title: Dependency update
candidates.body: A simple pull request to use `clap` v4.

candidates.title: Pr issue48
candidates.body: This pull request closes #48.

candidates.title: Some little, standalone changes all wrapped in one pull request
candidates.body:
- Fixed a typo in the `cycle` driver's documentation.
- Removed a nullable field in a GraphQL result.
- Updated dependencies.
- Added CORS support to the GraphQL interface.

None of these were huge changes by themselves, so I wrapped them in one pull-request.

candidates.title: Pr issue46
candidates.body: Closes #46.

candidates.title: Pr issue6
candidates.body: This is an ongoing pull request which will, eventually, add the logic support to DrMem.

candidates.title: Pr issue37
candidates.body:
Refactored the config file types into various modules. The `drmem-config` crate is gone.

Organized the workspace `Cargo.toml` file so common crates are defined there.

Updated the GitHub workflow to cache generated files so it speeds up further compiles needed by matrix settings.

candidates.title: :bug: pass down `redis` feature
candidates.body: When selecting the `redis-backend` feature, we weren't passing it to the `drmem-config` crate.

candidates.title: Add mDNS support
candidates.body: Closes #14

candidates.title: :memo: add more `rustdoc` content
candidates.body: Add some documentation.

candidates.title: Prep for release
candidates.body: This pull request has a few, final clean-up commits before we release v0.1.0.

candidates.title: :wrench: adjust `Cargo.toml` files
candidates.body:
- Update the license.
- Allow publishing.
- Update URLs to point to DrMemCS on GitHub.

candidates.title: Remove gRPC support
candidates.body: The GraphQL interface is working well and there are other, more important, things that need to be finished before added a second client interface. For now, the minimal gRPC support that existed is removed.

candidates.title: Fixing Redis
candidates.body: This pull request, when ready, will fix the redis backend so it supports the full GraphQL API.

candidates.title: Merge pull request
candidates.body: resolves #3
